meanings.definition: A type of lettuce with long, crisp leaves.
meanings.sent1: I love adding romaines to my salads for extra crunch.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store was out of romaines, so I had to choose a different type of lettuce.
meanings.sent3: The romaines in the salad were so fresh, they practically danced in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a sea of romaines, swaying gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The romaines glistened with dew, looking almost too beautiful to eat.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'romaine'.
meanings.sent1: We bought two heads of romaines at the market.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for romaines, but we only had one in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The romaines on the table seemed to multiply when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The romaines in the garden stood together like a small army of green soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The romaines overflowed from the basket, a testament to a successful harvest.
